keyword: how many calories in a cup of jasmine rice
title: How Many Calories in a Cup of Jasmine Rice?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a cup of jasmine rice, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per serving.
h1: How Many Calories in a Cup of Jasmine Rice?
assumptions: Cooked jasmine rice (white, long-grain), steamed or boiled in water, no added salt, oil, or seasonings; 1 cup ≈ 158 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cooking method, water absorption, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of cooked jasmine rice contains about 205 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Cooked with 1 tsp oil per cup

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of cooked jasmine rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 205 kcal for 1 cup cooked, plain jasmine rice.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in a cup of jasmine rice?
faqs.a: About 44.5 g of carbohydrates, with minimal fiber (0.6 g).

faqs.q: Is jasmine rice higher in calories than basmati?
faqs.a: Similar; jasmine has ~205 kcal per cup, basmati around 200 kcal.

faqs.q: Calories in uncooked jasmine rice per cup?
faqs.a: About 675 kcal per dry cup (≈185 g), which yields 3 cups cooked.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in jasmine rice?
faqs.a: Plain boiled/steamed is lowest; frying or adding oil increases by 40+ kcal per tsp.
